page.title: 11Smith's Bakery .
page.content: There has been a bakery in Leiston for the past 150 years. The present bakery is Smith's bakery. They bake different kinds of cakes, bread and rolls. At Smith's bakery they use yeast and warm water to make the rolls rise. To make the rolls you have to make them the right way. During the summer Smith's make up to 4,000 rolls a day for all the visitors to Leiston. To make the doughnuts they put the dough in to a prover to see if it is ready to fry. When it is they put the doughnuts in to a fat fryer and fry them in it for exactly for 4 minutes. Then the tray is raised up and the doughnuts are allowed to cool. Then they are taken over to the jam machine which squirts the jam into the doughnuts by means of a hollow tube. Sugar is sprinkled over the doughnuts.
